revised_title: Air Pollution Control in the United Kingdom: The Best Practicable Means Philosophy
tldr: This article discusses the air pollution control system in the United Kingdom, which is based on the best practicable means (b.p.m.) philosophy. The b.p.m. philosophy aims to optimize air pollution to serve the best interest of society, considering health, amenity effects, pollution arrestment techniques, industry finances, and national needs. The article explains the operation of the four basic components of the b.p.m. philosophy and compares it with alternative philosophies based on statutory air quality standards or emission standards.
